subject: Re: reg. JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Just to quibble.. but I d typically shorten that to: public void testAdd() { assertEquals(3, new AddInt().add(1, 2)); } Dave
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> Pallavi,
>
> it goes something like this:
>
> public class AddInt {
> public int add(int a, int b) {
> return a + b;
> }
> }
>
> public class TestAddInt extends TestCase {
> public TestAddInt(String testName) {
> super(testName);
> }
>
> public void testAdd() {
> int a = 1;
> int b = 2;
> int expected = a + b;
> assertEquals(expected, new AddInt().add(a, b));
> }
> }

Just to quibble.. but I'd typically shorten that to:

public void testAdd() {
assertEquals(3, new AddInt().add(1, 2));
}

Dave
